oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An Immersion and Invariance Algorithm for a Differential Algebraic System
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MANJAREKAR, NS
BANAVAR, RN
ORTEGA, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Immersion and Invariance
differential algebraic systems
transient stability
electrical power systems
POWER-SYSTEMS
EXCITATION CONTROL
TRANSIENT STABILIZATION
SYNCHRONOUS GENERATORS
ADAPTIVE STABILIZATION
NONLINEAR-SYSTEMS
DESIGN
CONTROLLER
MODEL
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A stability result based on the Immersion and Invariance control strategy is derived for a class of systems described by differential equations with algebraic constraints. The result is then applied to synthesize a stabilizing control law for a two machine electrical power system with a controllable series capacitor (CSC). The dynamics of the two-machine system. is given by differential equations and the active power balance at the load buses is given by algebraic equations. The CSC dynamics is described by a first order differential equation.
